explanation: Rinderpest is an infectious disease of ruminants, especially cattle, caused by a paramyxovirus. It is characterized by fever, dysentery, and inflammation of the mucous membranes.

text: If 25kg feed was consumed by 10,000 birds in six hours, determine the quantity of feed required by the same number of birds in one week?
explanation:
There are 168 hours in a week, which is 28 times the 6 hours it took the 10,000 birds to consumed 25kg feed (168hours / 6 hours)
To find the amount of feed the same number of birds would consume, mutiply 25kg 28 times. (25 x 28) = 700kg

text: One of the main reasons for providing light for broilers during production is to
explanation: Adequate lighting encourages activity and feeding behavior in broilers, which leads to higher feed intake and improved growth rates. While light can also help reduce stress and mortality, its primary function in production is to enhance feeding.

text: Which of the following birds is purposely raised for meat?
explanation: A broiler is any chicken that is bred and raised specifically for meat production.

text: pasture crops are best used in preparing silage when they
explanation: This is because crops in their vegetative state, before flowering, generally have higher moisture content and better nutritional value for silage.

text: Which of the following managment systems of poultry production is least expensive?
explanation: Free rangedenotes a method of farming husbandry where theanimals, for at least part of the day, can roam freely outdoors, rather than being confined in an enclosure for 24 hours each day.

text: In farm animals, hormones are released into the
explanation: Endocrine glands make chemicals calledhormonesand pass themstraight into the bloodstream.Hormonescan be thought of as chemical messages. From theblood stream, thehormonescommunicate with the body by headingtowardstheir target celltobring about a particular change or effecttothat cell.

text: Which of the following characteristics describes the external features of sheep?
explanation: Sheep are known for having short tails. as their tails are typically docked in many breeds for health and hygiene reasons.

text: In poultry, nutrients are absorded mainly in the
explanation: TheSmall Intestine in Chickenaids in digestion and nutrient absorption. Composed of the duodenum, jejunum and ileum.

text: A disadvantage of prolonged inbreeding in farm animals it that it leads to

options.D: production of animals with uniform characteristics

explanation: The genetic diversity or variability isreducedwith increase ininbreeding. Prolonged inbreeding leads to Inbreedingdepression which is thereducedbiologicalfitnessin a given population.

text: Which of the following factors affects the productivity of pasture? I Soil fertility II. Climate III. Weeds
explanation: Soil fertility as well as climatic factors like relative humidity, temperature, sunshine hours affect productivity of pastures.

text: If the oestrus cycle of a goat is 27 days, how many times will it come on heat in a year?
explanation: Theperiodfrom oneheat cycleto the next is referred to as theoestrus cycle. If the oestrus cycle is 27 day, the number of times heat will occur in ayearis derived by dividng the number of days in a year by the oestrus cycle ( 365/27 = 14 days)

text: Which of the following statements about ovulation in rabbits is correct?

options.C: Eggs are released in the absence of  a buck
options.D: Eggs are released in the presence of a buck

explanation: Rabbits are induced ovulators, meaning that ovulation occurs in response to mating. The presence of a buck stimulates the release of eggs.

text: Which of the following farm animals is a monogastric?
explanation: Ruminantsareanimalssuch as cattle, sheep, goats and deer. In comparison, animals such aspigs, dogs and horses have only a single stomach compartment and are called nonruminants, ormonogastric animals.

text: Which of the labelled part is used to determine a good layer?
explanation: For agood layer, the combs and wattles should be full, large, waxy, bright red and warm. A poorlayerhas small, scaly, pale, and shrivelled comb and wattles.

text: The fundamental principles underlying animal breeding is based on
explanation: Animal breeding is the process of selective mating of animals with desirable genetic traits, to maintain or enhance these traits in future generations. For livestock, this involves estimation of thegenetic valueof individuals for traits including growth rate and yield of products such as eggs, milk or meat.

text: Which of the following disease would directly affect milk production in cows
explanation: Mastitisin dairycowsis caused by udder infections, usually resulting from bacteria introduced either during the milking process or from environmental contact. Milk-secreting tissues and various ducts throughout the udder can be damaged by bacterial toxins, and sometimes permanent damage to the udder occurs.

text: Farm animals producing milk, egg and wool would require
explanation:
Production ration is the type of ration given to farm animals to enable them to produce. Categories of farm animals that require production ration include;
Hatchinganimals; formilk production
Layers; for production of more eggs
Pregnant animals; for growing foetus
Feathering animals; for extra addition of meat or flesh
